title: Disney Pledges $5 Million to Rebuild Altadenaâ€™s Charles White Park With Help From Imagineers
description: Disney has pledged $5 million to help rebuild a park in Altadena that was destroyed by Januaryâ€™s wildfire, with help from the members of the company
body:
Disney has pledged $5 million to help rebuild a park in Altadena that was destroyed by Januaryâ€™s wildfire, with help from the members of the companyâ€™s famously innovative Walt Disney Imagineering department.

	Charles White Park, which sits just off Fair Oaks Avenue near the Pasadena-Altadena border, will include â€œa new community center and an enhanced playground infused with Disney magic to bring joy to families in the area for its anticipated reopening in 2026,â€ Disney said.
	

	Disney disclosed Monday that some Imagineers have already been working with Los Angeles County officials on the site planning, landscape architecture and playground design for the five-acre site. Disney is supporting the rebuilding of the park as part of its $15 million donation to Los Angeles area wildfire relief that followed the wind-whipped infernos that devastated Altadena in the foothills above Pasadena  as well as across the county in Pacific Palisades near the Santa Monica coastline.


	Disney is also helping to rebuild two other park sites in Altadena that were nearly destroyed by the fire. A number of staff in Walt Disney Imagineering lost homes during the Altadena and Palisades fire, adding urgency and purpose to their work.

	â€œLos Angeles has been home to the Walt Disney Company since its founding more than a century ago, which is why we felt a special responsibility to help this community rebuild in the aftermath of the devastating wildfires earlier this year,â€ said Disney chief Bob Iger. â€œIâ€™m incredibly proud of our Imagineers who are volunteering their time and talents to help reimagine cherished public spaces like Charles White Park. Their work is not only a testament to Disneyâ€™s creative spirit, but also to our deep commitment to our neighbors throughout this region. We hope this effort brings comfort, joy, and a sense of renewal to the Altadena community for years to come.â€
	

	Kathryn Barger, member of the LA County Board of Supervisors, praised Disney for its donation of money as well as resources via the Imagineers.

	â€œKnowing that Disneyâ€™s Imagineers will pour their time, talent, and compassion into Altadenaâ€™s recovery is truly inspiring,â€ said Barger. â€œTheir work on Charles White Park and other community spaces is more than restoration. It is a gift of hope, joy, and healing for families who have endured so much this year.â€

	Disney has also embraced a longstanding Christmas tradition that kicks off the holiday season for many families in the wider area. Per the Disney annnouncement:

	â€œDisney is also supporting one of Altadenaâ€™s most cherished traditions: The Christmas Tree Lane Lighting Ceremony and Winter Festival on December 6. First organized in 1920, this event is one of the oldest large-scale outdoor Christmas light displays in the world. The company will bring some signature Disney Magic to the lighting event, including character appearances, festive moments, and meaningful volunteer opportunities to support families in need during the season. Disney also will help support the communityâ€™s annual toy drive with a donation of more than 1,000 toys that evening.â€

schema.headline: Disney Pledges $5 Million to Rebuild Altadenaâ€™s Charles White Park With Help From Imagineers

title: Roblox to Require All Users to Verify Age With Facial Recognition to Access Chat Features Beginning in December
description: Roblox will launch facial age checks as a requirement for all users who want to access communication features beginning next month. The gaming platf
body:
Roblox will launch facial age checks as a requirement for all users who want to access communication features beginning next month. The gaming platform has also implemented age-based chats to limit communication between minors and adults.

	Starting Tuesday, the process will be available as a voluntary feature across Roblox. Beginning the first week of December, Roblox will start to enforce the age-check requirement in select markets, including Australia, the Netherlands and New Zealand. The requirements are set to expand to the U.S. and other remaining markets where Robloxâ€™s chat rooms are available by early January 2026.
	

	Specific dates for the rollout have not yet been specified. 


	The new safety measures makes them the first online platform to require facial age checks to access chat rooms.

	As previously reported, the move comes amid recent lawsuits filed against Roblox regarding its child safety regulations and accusations of grooming behavior experienced on the platform.

	In September, Roblox first announced a goal to expand its age estimation technology to all of its users by the end of this year. 

	As of Tuesday, Roblox has also launched a newÂ Safety Center, meant to act as â€œa dedicated resource for parents and caregivers that provides clear guidance and tools to help them make informed decisions, set up Parental Controls, and support their childâ€™s online experience.â€

	â€œRobust and highly effective age assurance technology plays a critical role in maintaining the safety of child users online, helping to protect them from harmful and illegal content and high-risk interactions, whilst they develop age-appropriate digital literacy skills,â€ Stephen Balkam, CEO of the Family Online Safety Institute, said in a statement.
	

	Robloxâ€™s Facial Age Estimation process will be conducted by using the camera on the userâ€™s device through the app. Images and videos for age checks are processed by Persona, a Roblox vendor, and are deleted immediately after processing.

	After users complete the age-check process, users will be assigned to one of six age groups: under nine, nine to 12, 13 to 15, 16 to 17, 18 to 20 or 21 and up. 

	Designed to ensure safer, more age-appropriate interactions, players can chat only with peers in their group or similar groups.

	â€‹A spokesperson from the National Crime Agency described Robloxâ€™s latest safety feature as â€œrobust and highly effective age assurance technology plays a critical role in maintaining the safety of child users online, helping to protect them from harmful and illegal content and high-risk interactions, whilst they develop age-appropriate digital literacy skills.â€Â

schema.headline: Roblox to Require All Users to Verify Age With Facial Recognition to Access Chat Features Beginning in December

title: Doha Film Institute CEO Fatma Hassan Alremaihi on Spirit of New Doha Film Festival: â€˜Film, Gaming, Animation and Cosplay Are All Forms of Expression That Inspire and Unite Peopleâ€™
description: Doha Film Institute CEO Fatma Hassan Alremaihi, who over the past 15 years has been instrumental in turning the DFI into the regionâ€™s pre-eminent in
body:
Doha Film Institute CEO Fatma Hassan Alremaihi, who over the past 15 years has been instrumental in turning the DFI into the regionâ€™s pre-eminent indie industry driver with its film funding programs, is looking to take the DFIâ€™s role to the next level.

	Alremaihi is spearheading the launch of the upcoming Doha Film Festival, which runs Nov. 20-28 in the Qatari capital and will transform the DFIâ€™s existing Ajyal fest for youth audiences into a more ambitious international event for a broader audience.
	

	Characterized by a strong regional component and an accent on the Palestinian plight, the Doha Film Festival will open with Kaouther Ben Haniaâ€™s â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajab,â€ as previously announced.


	There will beÂ 97 films from 62 countries â€“ about half of which are cherry-picked regional premieres of titles that have already bowed at the worldâ€™s top festivals â€“ screening across different sections.

	But the Doha Film Festival will also intentionally overlap with Geekdom, Qatarâ€™s largest pop culture event, which spans from E-sports tournaments, to anime, cosplaying and live gaming, as well as film and music performances.

	Ahead of its inaugural edition, the DFI chief, who is also the festâ€™s artistic director, took questions from Variety and explained the spirit of the fest and the synergy between the two events. 

	Talk to me about the importance of amplifying Palestinian voices at the Doha Film Festival, starting with the opener, â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€

	DFI has always championed voices from underrepresented communities from around the world to bring balanced, truthful narratives to global audiences. So amplifying Palestinian stories has been essential in our work as a cultural organization. Cinema captures the perseverance of the human spirit like no other art form can, opens hearts and changes perspectives, and thatâ€™s never been more necessary than it is today.
	

	We remain steadfast in our commitment to the accurate portrayal of their lived experiences and humanity and opening with â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€ is an intentional choice. Â Itâ€™s a reminder of why cinema matters â€” because it bears witness, confronts truth, preserves memory, and restores humanity to those voices being reduced to headlines or silenced.

	Palestinian filmmakers have always shown extraordinary courage and artistry in telling stories of loss, resilience, and identity, and we are standing in solidarity by ensuring that their narratives are seen, discussed, and felt globally.

	What are the festivalâ€™s four world premieres? How important will it be for this event to get world premieres going forward?

	We are honored to host the world premieres of [Qatari thriller] â€œSa3oud Wainahâ€ by Mohammed Al-Ibrahim; â€œMy Storyâ€ [a doc about Syrian actor and political figure Jamal Soliman] by Egyptian director Yasser Ashour; â€œWhen the Camera Frozeâ€ by [Palestinian artist and war photographer Belal Khaled]; and â€œAbu Jabalâ€ by [Palestinian director] Bisan Owda â€” each a powerful original voice and a testament to the creativity and resilience of filmmakers who are redefining storytelling from our region.

	World premieres mean much more than the prestige or headlines they create â€“ it is the trust they represent. When a filmmaker chooses to share their film with the world for the first time here in Doha, they acknowledge our festival as an important place of discovery and dialogue.

	As we grow, we continue to strengthen our relationships and make Doha Film Festival a place where artists feel safe, supported and honored for their bold ideas, and where stories from the Arab world resonate beyond borders.

	Talk to me about the festivalâ€™s industry side. How is this fest going to help advance Qatarâ€™s role in the film, TV, and media sector?

	The DFF Talks include the industry component of the festival, with the Industry Days program presented by Film Committee at Media City Qatar. 

	These cover a broad spectrum of creative work that intersects with how films are made and what they are made about, contributing to Qatarâ€™s leadership as a global hub for creative development.

	The industry platform builds directly on 15 years of the DFIâ€™s longstanding mission of nurturing talent, connecting local and regional voices with international experts from the creative community.
	

	DFF 2025â€™s industry events reinforce Qatarâ€™s position as a dynamic hub for storytelling and creative production and the festivalâ€™s position as a launchpad for promising talent from our region. From facilitating co-productions to sales and distribution deals, we are growing a sustainable ecosystem for film, TV, and emerging media that turns creative ambition into lasting industry impact.

	How is the festival going to intersect with Geekdom, which is Qatarâ€™s largest pop culture event?

	Geekdom shares the same spirit as Doha Film Festival â€” one of imagination, creativity and community. As Qatarâ€™s homegrown pop culture convention, Geekdom has evolved into a beautiful space where our creative communities â€“ fans, gamers, artists and creators â€“ unite to honor what they love.

	The synergy between the two events expands the idea of storytelling to include the deep connection between cinema and popular culture. Film, gaming, animation and cosplay are all forms of expression that inspire and unite people, and this reflects our belief that creativity is not limited by the medium with which we choose to express it. Whether itâ€™s on the big screen or in a virtual world, the stories that resonate with us remind us of who we are and how we are connected through things that we love.

	This interviewÂ has been edited and condensed for clarity.

schema.headline: Doha Film Institute CEO Fatma Hassan Alremaihi on Spirit of New Doha Film Festival: â€˜Film, Gaming, Animation and Cosplay Are All Forms of Expression That Inspire and Unite Peopleâ€™

title: Sadie Sink and Noah Jupe to Star in New â€˜Romeo & Julietâ€™ Production on Londonâ€™s West End
description:
Sadie Sink and Noah Jupe will make their London West End debuts in a new production of â€œRomeo & Julietâ€ in March. 

	Directed by Robert Icke (â€œOedip
body:
Sadie Sink and Noah Jupe will make their London West End debuts in a new production of â€œRomeo & Julietâ€ in March. 

	Directed by Robert Icke (â€œOedipusâ€), Sink (â€œStranger Thingsâ€) and Jupe (â€œHamnet,â€ â€œA Quiet Placeâ€) will play the star-crossed lovers in Empire Street Productionsâ€™ adaptation of Shakespeareâ€™s classic play at the Harold Pinter Theatre. The show will run from March 16 to June 6, 2026. Tickets go on sale at 10 a.m. local time on Wednesday. 
	


	Sink, who began her career playing the lead role in â€œAnnieâ€ on Broadway, is fresh off her first Tony nomination for her starring role in the play â€œJohn Proctor Is the Villain.â€ She broke out as Max Mayfield in â€œStranger Things,â€ a role she will reprise for the final time in the showâ€™s upcoming fifth season later this month. â€œJohn Proctor Is the Villainâ€ recently announced a West End run at the Royal Court Theatre next spring, though the cast has not yet been revealed. 


	Jupe gained prominence for his roles in â€œThe Night Managerâ€ (2016) and â€œThe Undoingâ€ (2020), before breaking out in â€œA Quiet Placeâ€ in 2021. He is currently starring in Chloe Zhaoâ€™s â€œHamnetâ€ alongside Paul Mescal and Jessie Buckley, which is heavily tipped for Oscars glory. 

	Further cast for â€œRomeo & Julietâ€ will be announced soon. The showâ€™s creatives include set and costume designer Hildegard Bechtler, lighting designer Jon Clark, sound designer Tom Gibbons and video designer Ash J. Woodward. The casting directors are Julia Horan, CDG and Jim Carnahan, CSA. 

	Deadline was the first to report the news.

schema.headline: Sadie Sink and Noah Jupe to Star in New â€˜Romeo & Julietâ€™ Production on Londonâ€™s West End

title: Disney+ and CJ ENMâ€™s Tving Launch Bundle Deal in Korea
description: Disney+ has forged a groundbreaking partnership with CJ ENMâ€˜s Korean streaming platform Tving, introducing bundled subscription packages that combin
body:
Disney+ has forged a groundbreaking partnership with CJ ENMâ€˜s Korean streaming platform Tving, introducing bundled subscription packages that combine global and local content at discounted rates â€” a first-of-its-kind collaboration between an international and local streaming service in South Korea.

	The deal offers Korean consumers two bundle options launching immediately: a Disney+,Tving and local streamer Wavve package at KRW21,500 ($14.60) monthly, representing up to 37% savings compared to separate subscriptions, and a Disney+-Tving bundle at KRW18,000 ($12.30) monthly, offering 23% savings against the combined cost of Disney+ Standard and Tving Standard.
	

	The bundled plans provide access to Disneyâ€™s franchise content from Marvel, Pixar, Star Wars, National Geographic and Hulu, alongside Disney+ Korean originals and popular Korean dramas, variety programming and entertainment from Tving, Wavve and CJ ENM.


	The Korean deal follows a content partnership in Japan. Since Nov. 5, Disney+ Japan has begun rolling out up to 60 Korean titles, including CJ ENM hits â€œGuardian: The Lonely and Great God (Goblin)â€ and â€œReply 1988.â€ Tving original series â€œDear Xâ€ premiered exclusively on Disney+ Japan on Nov. 6, marking the platformâ€™s first major push into the Japanese market.

	Tony Zameczkowski, senior VP and general manager of direct-to-consumer for Asia Pacific at Walt Disney Company, said: â€œBy partnering with Tving and Wavve, weâ€™re expanding our reach, enriching the content ecosystem, and offering greater value to consumers. Weâ€™re also proud to support the global journey of Korean content and hope this sets a new standard for cross-border collaboration in the streaming industry.â€
	

	Kim Soyoun, managing director of Walt Disney Company Korea, added: â€œThis collaboration not only enhances the value we offer to Korean consumers but also strengthens our role as a bridge between local creativity and global audiences.â€ 

	Tving CEO Julie Choi said: â€œWe also look forward to seeing more Korean stories reach new audiences around the world and be loved by them through our collaboration with Disney+ Japan.â€ 

	The partnership arrives as Disney+ continues expanding its Korean content slate with originals including â€œMoving,â€ â€œLow Lifeâ€ and â€œTempest,â€ along with new formats like mid-form variety series â€œWeekly Entertainment Arcade.â€ The platform positions itself as a dual destination for both Disneyâ€™s century-long catalog of global entertainment and growing Korean productions.

schema.headline: Disney+ and CJ ENMâ€™s Tving Launch Bundle Deal in Korea

title: NBA Makes Disney+ Philippines Debut in Multi-Year Streaming Deal
description: The NBA is coming to Disney+ Philippines for the first time under a new multi-year agreement, expanding the global partnership between The Walt Disn
body:
The NBA is coming to Disney+ Philippines for the first time under a new multi-year agreement, expanding the global partnership between The Walt Disney Company, ESPN and the league.

	Filipino basketball fans will gain access to live NBA games, ESPN documentaries and broadcasts of â€œNBA Countdownâ€ starting with a Nov. 20 doubleheader featuring the Houston Rockets at Cleveland Cavaliers and New York Knicks at Dallas Mavericks. The platform will also carry studio shows â€œNBA Tip-Offâ€ and the Emmy-winning â€œInside the NBA,â€ hosted by Shaquille Oâ€™Neal, Ernie Johnson, Kenny Smith and Charles Barkley.
	

	The deal gives Disney+ Philippines subscribers exclusive streaming rights to select regular season and playoff games, plus marquee events including Christmas Day games, the NBA Draft, the All-Star Celebrity Game and select Summer League contests. Each season, one Conference Finals series will stream live, with the other Conference Finals and NBA Finals available on delay.


	â€œFor millions of Filipinos, basketball isnâ€™t just a sport â€“ itâ€™s a passion, a shared language and a powerful source of national pride,â€ said Vineet Puri, VP and general manager of The Walt Disney Company Southeast Asia. â€œThrough this unique deal, we are bringing basketball fans in the Philippines closer than ever to the teams and players they love with all the NBA-focused programming while enjoying the best in global entertainment all on Disney+.â€

	Kelly Cooke, head of content partnerships and DTC at NBA Asia, added: â€œOur collaboration with Disney+ Philippines makes it easier than ever for our passionate fans across the country to access the NBA, experience iconic moments from throughout the season and follow their favorite teams and players on the devices and platforms they use most.â€
	

	The NBA programming joins Disney+â€™s library of content from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Hulu, including upcoming releases like â€œThe Fantastic Four: First Steps,â€ Korean series â€œTempestâ€ and â€œThe Manipulated,â€ and Emmy-winning shows like â€œShÅgunâ€ and â€œThe Bear.â€

schema.headline: NBA Makes Disney+ Philippines Debut in Multi-Year Streaming Deal

title: Pingyao, Warsaw Winner â€˜The World of Loveâ€™ Makes a Mark at Korean Box Office, Earns Industry Acclaim
description: Yoon Ga-eunâ€˜s â€œThe World of Loveâ€ has emerged as a breakout success in South Koreaâ€˜s independent film sector, drawing widespread praise from top-tie
body:
Yoon Ga-eunâ€˜s â€œThe World of Loveâ€ has emerged as a breakout success in South Koreaâ€˜s independent film sector, drawing widespread praise from top-tier filmmakers.

	â€œThe World of Loveâ€ has surpassed 100,000 admissions at the Korean box office as of Nov. 14, and the filmâ€™s box office is north of $700,000. 

	The feature has attracted notable support from prominent figures in the industry, including Bong Joon Ho, Kim Jee-woon, Yeon Sang-ho, Kim Tae-ri, Kore-eda Hirokazu, Jia Zhangke, BTS member RM and Greta Lee.
	

	Director Bong hosted a talk session focused on the film, building on his long-standing admiration for Yoonâ€™s work. He has previously described her as one of three masters at directing child actors alongside Abbas Kiarostami and Kore-eda.


	During the session, Bong said the film qualified as a masterpiece after his second viewing. â€œThere was so much to dig into in this film, and I even felt professional jealousy,â€ he said. He highlighted Yoonâ€™s distinctive approach to storytelling, noting that she allows audiences to gradually understand the narrative through extended observation rather than direct explanation. He singled out the car wash sequence as particularly striking, calling it â€œthe sequence of the year.â€ Bong jokingly referred to himself as the â€œSeoul Branch Chief of Director Yoon Ga-eunâ€™s Fan Club.â€

	Other industry figures have added their endorsements. Kim Jee-woon called it â€œthis yearâ€™s best independent film,â€ praising Yoonâ€™s perspective as warm and profound while declaring her the future of Korean cinema. Yeon Sang-ho described it as a masterpiece from a filmmaker who â€œwalks to a different rhythm.â€
	

	Chinese director Jia Zhangke added: â€œAs one of the very first audiences of the film, I would confidently recommend it.â€ Actor Kim Tae-ri said the film was extraordinary and hoped more audiences could experience it, while Park Jung-min remarked that â€œsomething incredible has been born.â€ Greta Lee simply called it â€œa perfect film.â€

	The title has gained traction on the festival circuit, collecting jury and audience awards at Pingyao International Film Festivalâ€™s Crouching Tigers section, along with the Fipresci Award at the Warsaw Film Festival. The film recently played at the Cork International Film Festivalâ€™s Momentum section.

	Upcoming festival appearances include competition slots at QCinema International Film Festivalâ€™s Asian Next Wave section, Festival des 3 Continents Nantes, Tokyo FILMeX, Jogja-Netpac Asian Film Festival and Red Sea International Film Festival. The film has also earned a nomination for Best Youth Film at the Asia Pacific Screen Awards.

schema.headline: Pingyao, Warsaw Winner â€˜The World of Loveâ€™ Makes a Mark at Korean Box Office, Earns Industry Acclaim

title: â€˜Now You See Me: Now You Donâ€™tâ€™ Edges â€˜The Running Manâ€™ at U.K., Ireland Box Office
description: Lionsgate U.K.â€™s â€œNow You See Me: Now You Donâ€™tâ€ narrowly claimed the No. 1 position at the U.K. and Ireland box office, opening with Â£2,384,018 ($3
body:
Lionsgate U.K.â€™s â€œNow You See Me: Now You Donâ€™tâ€ narrowly claimed the No. 1 position at the U.K. and Ireland box office, opening with Â£2,384,018 ($3,132,924), according to Comscore. 

	Paramountâ€™s â€œThe Running Manâ€ was a whisker behind, also launching to Â£2,383,269 ($3,131,904), with very little separating the two debuts in what was effectively a photo finish at the top of the chart.


	Disneyâ€™s â€œPredator: Badlandsâ€ slid to third place but remained a solid draw, scaring up $1.2 million in its second frame for a running total of $5.6 million. New entry â€œNuremberg,â€ from Studiocanal, arrived in fourth with $1.2 million, while Sonyâ€™s anime feature â€œJujutsu Kaisen: Executionâ€ rounded out the top five on $1.1 million, all of which counts as its cumulative gross.
	

	Further down the chart, Sonyâ€™sâ€œThe Choralâ€ ranked sixth, adding $800,000 in its second weekend to reach approximately $3.4 million. True Brit Entertainmentâ€™s â€œChristmas Karmaâ€ opened at No. 7 with $500,000. In eighth place, Paramountâ€™s â€œRegretting Youâ€ collected $500,000, pushing its total to $7.8 million. Paramountâ€™s family spin-off â€œA Paw Patrol Christmasâ€ padded the No. 9 slot with $300,000 for a cumulative $700,000, while Universalâ€™s sci-fi thriller â€œBugoniaâ€ completed the top 10 with a shade under $300,000 lifting its total to $3.5 million.

	A varied slate rolls out across the U.K. and Ireland this week, beginning on Tuesday with â€œLa Traviata â€“ OperaGlass Works 2025,â€ distributed by 606 Distribution. The filmed staging adds another operatic entry to the yearâ€™s growing pipeline of event-cinema titles.
	

	On Thursday, Dreamz Entertainment unveils Telugu-language film â€œPremante,â€ expanding the weekâ€™s South Asian representation before a crowded Friday corridor led by two major national releases. Universal Pictures launches â€œWicked: For Good,â€ Jon M. Chuâ€™s big-screen continuation of the â€œWickedâ€ franchise, featuring Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo, Jonathan Bailey, Ethan Slater, Michelle Yeoh and Jeff Goldblum. Positioned in more than 300 locations, it is one of the weekâ€™s widest openers. 

	Sony Pictures counters with â€œSisu: Road to Revenge,â€ Jalmari Helanderâ€™s action-revenge thriller starring Jorma Tommila, Richard Brake and Stephen Lang. Also landing wide on Friday, the title rolls out in more than 300 sites.

	Vue LumiÃ¨re offers â€œThe Thing With Feathers,â€ starring Benedict Cumberbatch, while BFI Distribution releases Lucile HadÅ¾ihaliloviÄ‡â€™s â€œThe Ice Tower,â€ led by Marion Cotillard and Clara Pacini. MusicFilmNetwork presents the documentary â€œThe Session Man â€“ The Nicky Hopkins Story,â€ profiling the celebrated pianist through interviews with contributors including Keith Richards, Mick Jagger, Albert Lee and Pete Townshend.

	Additional releases include the war epic â€œ120 Bahadurâ€ from Bakrania Media; Verve Picturesâ€™ horror â€œGameâ€; the family-facing â€œCBeebies Panto 2025: Cinderellaâ€; Altitudeâ€™s horror â€œThe Carpenterâ€™s Son,â€ headlined by Nicolas Cage; Zee Studios Internationalâ€™s raunchy comedy â€œMastiii 4â€; the Netflixâ€™s â€œThe Stringer: The Man Who Took the Photoâ€ ; Miracle/Underground/Rocliffeâ€™s â€œTestimonyâ€; and Dreamz Entertainmentâ€™s â€œEko.â€

	The week concludes on Saturday with another operatic event-cinema title, â€œArabella â€“ Met Opera 2025,â€ via Trafalgar Releasing.

schema.headline: â€˜Now You See Me: Now You Donâ€™tâ€™ Edges â€˜The Running Manâ€™ at U.K., Ireland Box Office

title: Steven Soderbergh, Michaela Coel Set to Attend Doha Film Festival, Which Will Kick Off With â€˜The Voice of Hind Rajabâ€™ as Qatar Steps Up Film Ambitions
description: The inaugural Doha Film Festival launches Thursday with the official Middle East premiere of Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Haniaâ€™s politically char
body:
The inaugural Doha Film Festival launches Thursday with the official Middle East premiere of Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Haniaâ€™s politically charged drama â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€ and a slew of regional premieres, including Steven Soderberghâ€™s black comedy â€œThe Christophersâ€ with the director and its star Michaela Coel on hand.

	Rami Malek, who is the first actor of Egyptian heritage to win the best actor Oscar (for â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€), is also set to make the trek to the Qatari capital for the event, which aims to raise Qatarâ€™s profile on the global film industry map.
	

	Itâ€™s significant that Ben Haniaâ€™s moving drama â€“ which tells the true story of a 5-year-old Palestinian girl who was stranded in a car that was attacked by Israeli forces in Gaza and later found dead â€“ is launching into the region from Qatar, which has been a key mediator in cease-fire negotiations involving Israel and Hamas.


	Equally relevant is the fact that â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€ previously opened the first edition of the Gaza International Festival for Womenâ€™s Cinema held Oct. 26-31 amid the rubble in Deir Al-Balah â€” a Palestinian city roughly nine miles outside Gaza City in the heart of the Gaza strip, marking the filmâ€™s de facto Middle East premiere.

	But the filmâ€™s real launch in the Arab world will be taking place in Doha.

	â€œIâ€™m very happy that the movie is launching from Doha, who wanted the [regional] premiere,â€ Ben Hania told Variety, noting that when she told Doha organizers that the â€œpop upâ€ Gaza fest wanted to show it first, â€œthey immediately said: yes, sure.â€
	

	Other films featuring Palestine at the new Doha fest â€“  which will run Nov. 20â€“28 â€“ are competition entries â€œOnce Upon a Time in Gaza,â€ directed by Palestinian directorial duo Tarzan and Arab Nasser, which world premiered in Cannes, and Kamal Aljafariâ€™s doc â€œWith Hasan in Gaza.â€ Â 

	Standout titles in the competition strand also include â€œThe Presidentâ€™s Cakeâ€ from Iraqi filmmaker Hasan Hadi, about a young school girl chosen to bake a celebratory dessert in observation of Saddam Husseinâ€™s birthday, which is representing Iraq at the Oscars; â€œKhartoum,â€ the potent doc about five residents forced to flee the Sudanese capitalâ€™s conflict that launched from Sundance; and Iranian director Ali Asgariâ€™s dark comedy about Iranian film censorship,Â â€œDivine Comedy.â€

	â€œThe Christophersâ€ will be among the Doha festâ€™s special screenings that also include Jim Sheridanâ€™s courtroom drama â€œRe-Creationâ€; Andy Mundy-Castleâ€™s doc â€œShoot the People,â€ about Nigerian photographer and activist Misan Harriman; Yasser Ashourâ€™s â€œMy Story,â€Â about the life and political journey of Syrian actor and activist Jamal Soliman â€“ who will be honored during the festivalâ€™s opening ceremony. Then there is the world premiere of Qatari thrillerÂ â€œSa3oud Wainahâ€Â by Mohammed Al-Ibrahim, produced by Katara Studios, which stands as testimony to Qatarâ€™s moviemaking ambitions.

	Besides Soderbergh, Coel and Malek, other prominent names set to make the trek to the Qatari capital comprise Turkish TV talentsÂ Engin Altan Duzyatan (â€œResurrection:Â ErtuÄŸrulâ€) and Hazal Kaya (â€œMidnight at the Pera Palaceâ€); Tunisian/Egyptian multi-hyphenateÂ Dorra Zarrouk (â€œWalls,â€ â€œZombie Goes Zombieâ€); and Palestinian starsÂ Saleh Bakri and Hiam Abbass (â€œSuccessionâ€).

	The new Doha Film Festival is run by the Doha Film Institute. It transforms the DFIâ€™s existing Ajyal Film Festival, dedicated to youth and family-friendly cinema,Â into a more ambitious international event for a broader audience. The new fest has four competition strands: international feature film competition, short film competition, the Ajyal film competition (judged by the festivalâ€™s unique youth jury), and the Made in Qatar competition, dedicated to projects made in Qatar regardless of the directorâ€™s provenance.
	

	The Doha Film Festival is being endowed with a total prize pot of over $300,000 that places it on a monetary par with Saudi Arabiaâ€™s more glitzy Red Sea Film festival in Jeddah.

	The Nov. 20â€“28 event is the latest addition to an already crowded Arab film festival calendar during the Fall/Winter season. The Cairo fest runs Nov. 12-21, the Marrakech fest runs Nov. 28-Dec. 6 and Red Seaâ€™s fifth edition is set for Dec. 4-13.

	Just as the tiny Arab state, rich in oil and gas, diversifies from the energy sector into cultural and media and entertainment â€” as attested by broadcaster Al Jazeera and theÂ 2022 FIFA World Cup soccer tournament â€” the DFI has steadily grown into a crucial cornerstone of the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region film industry.

	â€œAs Qatarâ€™s cultural presence expands and the regional film landscape matures, we saw an opportunity to elevate our festival offering. Doha Film Festival (DFF) builds on Ajyalâ€™s success but introduces broader industry engagement, global programming and new pathways for cultural exchange,â€Â DFI CEO Fatma Hassan Al Remaihi recently told Variety.

	The Doha Film Festival does not have a structured market. The DFI already has a unique event called Qumra, an incubator and co-production market that helps foster first and second works, mostly by Arab directors. Qumra, which was conceived by the DFI following the failure of the Tribeca Doha Film Festival, which ran from 2009 until 2012, recently held its 11th edition. Qumra mentors this year included Johnnie To, Walter Salles and Darius Khondji.

	However the Doha fest does have an industry program presented by the Qatar Film Committee, an official body that is part of the Media City Qatar hub and is tasked with driving growth of the countryâ€™s entertainment industry. This program will include a series of panels held by, among others, former MSNBC broadcast journalist Mehdi Hassan, founder of media company Zeteo;Â Egyptian journalist and Palestinian rights advocateÂ Rahma Zein; and Emmy-nominated journalist and Vice and HBO correspondent Ahmed Shihab-Eldin.

	It will be interesting to see if and how this new festival will succeed in strengthening Qatarâ€™s cultural soft power.Â

schema.headline: Steven Soderbergh, Michaela Coel Set to Attend Doha Film Festival, Which Will Kick Off With â€˜The Voice of Hind Rajabâ€™ as Qatar Steps Up Film Ambitions

title: Payal Kapadia, Rima Das Among Indian Filmmakers Demanding Fair Screenings for Indies After Kanu Behlâ€™s Cannes-Selected â€˜Agraâ€™ Gets Limited Theatrical Slots
description: A coalition of 46 prominent Indian independent filmmakers has issued a joint statement demanding equitable theatrical opportunities for indie cinema
body:
A coalition of 46 prominent Indian independent filmmakers has issued a joint statement demanding equitable theatrical opportunities for indie cinema, citing the restricted Indian release of Kanu Behlâ€˜s Cannes-selected feature â€œAgraâ€ as emblematic of systemic challenges facing the sector.

	The appeal follows the Nov. 14 theatrical bow of â€œAgra,â€ which was relegated to limited and inconvenient showtimes despite strong audience interest and extensive media coverage. Signatories include Payal Kapadia, Rima Das, Nandita Das, Ajitpal Singh, Alankrita Shrivastava, Megha Ramaswamy, Raam Reddy, Ruchi Narain, Shaunak Sen, Shonali Bose, Varun Grover and Vasan Bala.
	

	â€œUpdate on â€˜Agraâ€™, the film: Weâ€™re being denied shows because of the so called â€˜big blockbustersâ€™ and because small films â€˜donâ€™t fit intoâ€™ multiplex chain programming. Itâ€™s up to you the audience now! Speak up and tag the chains. Say that you want to see the film!,â€ Behl had posted on the eve of the release. â€œSpread the word. Or this will just go on and on. And the space for anything else other than mindless â€˜infantilised cinemaâ€™ will disappear.â€The indie filmmakersâ€™ statement emphasizes that the issue extends beyond a single release, noting that independent features across India routinely face barriers to theatrical exhibition. Key challenges identified include severely restricted screening slots, morning-only or weekday-exclusive showtimes, abrupt cancellations, opaque allocation processes and multiplex prioritization of big-budget releases.


	The filmmakers also highlighted an emerging obstacle in the streaming sector, where platforms increasingly base acquisition decisions on box office performance, creating what they describe as an inequitable cycle that limits indie filmsâ€™ theatrical exposure while simultaneously demanding commercial results.

	The coalition outlined five specific requests: guaranteed accessible evening screenings for every independent release, transparent criteria for screen allocation, regular monthly or quarterly indie showcase programming, support from cultural institutions and alternative venues, and streaming acquisition policies independent of theatrical performance metrics.
	

	The statement contextualizes these demands within Indian independent cinemaâ€™s international impact over the past decade, noting that films from the sector have premiered at major festivals including Cannes, Venice, Berlin, Sundance, Locarno, Rotterdam and Busan, expanding global perceptions of Indian storytelling.

	â€œWe offer this statement with respect, seriousness and urgency,â€ the filmmakers wrote. â€œNo antagonist. No blame. Only the collective need for a healthier ecosystem. Indian independent cinema has shaped how the world sees us. Now, we must shape a system where our own audiences can see us too.â€

	The complete list of signatories in alphabetical order: Aamir Bashir, Aditya Kripalani, Aditya Vikram Sengupta, Ajitpal Singh, Akshay Indikar, Alankrita Shrivastava, Anuparna Roy, Arati Kadav, Ashim Ahluwalia, Bauddhayan Mukherji, Bhaskar Hazarika, Chaitanya Tamhane, Devashish Makhija, Dibakar Das Roy, Diwa Shah, Dominic Megam Sangma, Gurvinder Singh, Haobam Paban Kumar, Hardik Mehta, Honey Trehan, Kanu Behl, Karan Gour, Karan Talwar, Karan Tejpal, Leena Yadav, Megha Ramaswamy, Nandita Das, Payal Kapadia, Pradip Kurbah, Prateek Vats, Q (Quashik Mukherjee), Raam Reddy, Rahat Mahajan, Rima Das, Ronny Sen, Ruchi Narain, Sumit Purohit, Safdar Rahman, Sarvnik Kaur, Shaunak Sen, Sharukhkhan Chavada, Shlok Sharma, Shonali Bose, Tanuja Chandra, Varun Grover and Vasan Bala.

schema.headline: Payal Kapadia, Rima Das Among Indian Filmmakers Demanding Fair Screenings for Indies After Kanu Behlâ€™s Cannes-Selected â€˜Agraâ€™ Gets Limited Theatrical Slots

title: Porsha Williams Lands on FBI's Radar After Incident on Delta Flight
description:
Porsha Williams
                          Flying on FBI's Radar ...
                          All
body:
Porsha Williams
                          Flying on FBI's Radar ...
                          All Smiles After Flight Incident
                      
                  
                        Published November 17, 2025 2:30 PM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated November 18, 2025 4:11 AM PST
                                    
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          Porsha Williams is on the radar of federal authorities ... after allegedly being involved in an incident on a Delta flight.
      
    
          The incident apparently went down Sunday night on a flight from Las Vegas to Atlanta. In footage, obtained by TMZ, Porsha is seen strutting out of the gate in a fur coat and Uggs --and from the looks of it, she doesnâ€™t seem fazed at all.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The reality star is accompanied by an officer, who she appears to speak with shortly after deplaning.
      
    
          A spokesperson for FBI Atlanta tells TMZ â€¦ "FBI Atlanta is aware of an incident on a Delta flight on November 16th allegedly involving Porsha Williams and/or at least one other person. We are looking to see whether any federal charges may or may not apply."
      
    
          A spokesperson for Delta Airlines tells TMZ ... two customers on the flight were spoken to by cabin crew, and the flight continued on to Atlanta and landed without issue. Law enforcement met the flight upon arrival at ATL.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          What exactly happened on Porshaâ€™s flight remains unclear.
      
    
          Porsha spent the weekend in Las Vegas at BravoCon with her â€œReal Housewives of Atlantaâ€ cast mates â€¦ taking part in panels and posing for the cameras.
      
    
          We reached out to Porsha ... so far, no word back.
      
      
              
          
                          
                Porsha Williams

schema.headline: Porsha Williams Lands on FBI's Radar After Incident on Delta Flight

title: Liev Schreiber Hospitalized in New York, Undergoing Tests
body:
Liev Schreiber
                          Hospitalized In NYC
                      
                  
                        Published November 17, 2025 2:10 PM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated November 17, 2025 4:10 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          UPDATE
      
          4:09 PM PT -- Liev's rep tells TMZ, "Out of an abundance of caution, Liev went into the hospital for testing and as of this afternoon, he has been cleared to return to work."
      
    
          Health scare for Liev Schreiber ... he's hospitalized in New York City, where he's going through a battery of tests.
      
    
          Sources with direct knowledge tell TMZ â€¦ the "Ray Donovan" star had a massive headache Sunday and he called his doctor, who told him to immediately go to a hospital.
      
    
          We're told 58-year-old Liev followed his doctor's advice and stayed overnight Sunday at a NYC hospital ... and today, doctors have been running tests on him.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          It's unclear what is ailing Liev -- our sources say doctors don't know the nature of the problem -- but we're told Liev is able to speak and walk without any issues and has the full use of his limbs.
      
    
          Story developing ...

title: Raul Sanchero In "Dangerous Minds" 'Memba Him?!
body:

          Puerto Rican actor and singer Renoly Santiago was in his early 20s when he played the reputation protecting Raul Sanchero -- opposite Michelle Pfeiffer -- in the 1995 cinematic masterpiece "Dangerous Minds."
      
    
          In addition to Pfeiffer, Renoly hit the big screen with Wade Dominguez, Bruklin Harris and George Dzundza.
